required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Assess the Efficacy of the iTind in Subjects With Symptomatic BPH
clinical_study.official_title: One-arm, Multi-center, International Prospective Study to Assess the Efficacy of Medi-tate Temporary Implantable Nitinol Device (iTind) in Subjects With Symptomatic Benign Prostatic Hypertrophy (BPH)

brief_summary.textblock:
A total of up to 200 Symptomatic BPH subjects subjects will be enrolled into the study.
Study duration will be 12 months post implantation with a follow-up visits at Year 2 and Year 3.

detailed_description.textblock:
Primary Study Objective:
The study's primary objective is to assess the efficacy of the MediTate iTind in subjects with symptomatic BPH by reduction of IPSS ) (International Prostate Symptoms Score) score.
Secondary Study Objectives:
- To further evaluate the efficacy of MediTate iTind as determined by increase of maximal urinary peak flow, satisfaction from the device and procedures, sex performance capabilities and ejaculation.
- Safety will be assessed by the rate of complications attributed to the MediTate iTind and its implantation/retrieval procedures.

primary_outcome.measure: IPSS (International Prostate Symptoms Score) Responders Rate
primary_outcome.description: the Proportion (%) of Total IPSS Responders (3 points) Rate

secondary_outcome.measure: Total IPSS (International Prostate Symptoms Score) Score at
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline to Month 6 in Total IPSS Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Total IPSS(International Prostate Symptoms Score) Urinary Symptoms Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline to Month 6 in Total IPSS Urinary Symptoms Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Total SHIM (Sexual Health Inventory for Men ) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline to Month 6 in Total SHIM Score
Change from Baseline to Month 6 in Total ISI Score

secondary_outcome.measure: Total EJ-MSHQ ( Ejaculation- Male Sexual Health questionnaire) Score
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline to Month 6 in Total EJ-MSHQ Score
Change from Baseline to Month 6 in Total Flow
Change from Baseline to Month 6 in Total residual urine
Change from Baseline to Month 6 in Total Satisfaction Rate
Change from Baseline to Month 6 in IPSS QoL score

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects eligible for this clinical study must fulfill all of the following:
- Subject signed informed consent prior to the performance of any study procedures.
- Male with symptomatic BPH: IPSS symptom severity score ≥ 10.
- Peak urinary flow of < 12 ml/sec at flowmetry.
- Prostate volume (as assessed by TRUS) < 120 mL
- Retrograde ejaculation (alfa-blockers side-effect)
- Marion's disease
- Subject that able to complete the study protocol.
- Normal Urinalysis and urine culture
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous prostate surgery
- Prostate cancer
- Urethral stricture
- Bladder stones
- UTI
- Obstructing median lobe
- Neurological conditions potentially affecting voiding function
